factoid: Sónya thought she probably opened the letter without knowing who it was from.
Sónya probably is offended by the letter.
Sónya could not do such a thing.
Sónya wiped away her tears and went up to Natásha, scanning Natásha’s face.
Sónya said "Natásha!" to Natásha.
Natásha awoke and saw Sónya.
Natásha said "Ah, you’re back?" to Sónya.
Natásha embraced Sónya with decision and tenderness.
Natásha noticed Sónya’s embarrassment and her own face expressed confusion and suspicion.
Natásha demanded "Sónya, you’ve read that letter?".
Sónya answered "Yes." to Natásha.
Natásha smiled rapturously after Sónya answered.
Natásha said "No, Sónya, I can’t any longer!".
Natásha said "I can’t hide it from you any longer.".
Natásha said "You know, we love one another!".
Natásha said "Sónya, darling, he writes... Sónya...".
Natásha asked "And Bolkónski?".
Natásha cried "Ah, Sónya, if you only knew how happy I am!".
Natásha said "You don’t know what love is.".
Natásha asked "But, Natásha, can that be all over?".
Natásha looked at Sónya with wide-open eyes as if she could not grasp the question.
Sónya said "Well, then, are you refusing Prince Andrew?".
Natásha said "Oh, you don’t understand anything! Don’t talk nonsense, just listen!".
Sónya insisted "But I can’t believe it.".
Sónya said "I don’t understand.".
Sónya said "How is it you have loved a man for a whole year and suddenly...".
Sónya said "Why, you have only seen him three times!".
Sónya said "Natásha, I don’t believe you, you’re joking!".
Sónya said "In three days to forget everything and so...".
Natásha said "Three days?".
Natásha said "It seems to me I’ve loved him a hundred years.".
Natásha said "It seems to me that I have never loved anyone before.".
Natásha said "You can’t understand it.".
Natásha said "Sónya, wait a bit, sit here.".
Natásha embraced and kissed Sónya.
Natásha said "I had heard that it happens like this, and you must have heard it too.".
Natásha said "but it’s only now that I feel such love.".
Natásha said "It’s not the same as before.".
Natásha said "As soon as I saw him I felt he was my master and I his slave.".
Natásha said "and that I could not help loving him.".
Natásha said "Yes, his slave!".
Natásha said "Whatever he orders I shall do.".
Natásha said "You don’t understand that.".
Natásha said "What can I do? What can I do, Sónya?".
Sónya cried "But think what you are doing.".
Sónya said "I can’t leave it like this.".
Sónya said "This secret correspondence...".
Sónya said "How could you let him go so far?".
Natásha replied "I told you that I have no will.".
Natásha said "Why can’t you understand? I love him!".
Sónya said "Then I won’t let it come to that... I shall tell!".
Sónya cried "I shall tell!".
Natásha declared "If you tell, you are my enemy!".
Natásha said "You want me to be miserable, you want us to be separated.".
Sónya shed tears of shame and pity for Natásha.
Sónya asked "But what has happened between you?".
Sónya asked "What has he said to you?".
Sónya asked "Why doesn’t he come to the house?".
Natásha did not answer Sónya’s questions.
Natásha entreated "For God’s sake, Sónya, don’t tell anyone, don’t torture me.".
Natásha said "Remember no one ought to interfere in such matters!".
Natásha said "I have confided in you.".
Sónya asked "But why this secrecy?".
Sónya asked "Why doesn’t he come to the house?".
Sónya asked "Why doesn’t he openly ask for your hand?".
Sónya said "You know Prince Andrew gave Natásha complete freedom—if it is really so; but I don’t believe it!".
Sónya asked "Natásha, have you considered what these secret reasons can be?".
Kúrágin is a deceiver and a villain.
Sónya wonders if she could have left off loving Prince Andrew.
Sónya wonders how she could let Kúrágin go to such lengths.
Sónya says that Prince Andrew gave Natásha complete freedom, but Sónya does not believe it.
